newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: MANILA'S PHIBOR RATES SLIGHTLY HIGHER.
newsitem.headline: MANILA'S PHIBOR RATES SLIGHTLY HIGHER.

text.p: The Philippine interbank offered rates (PHIBOR) rose slightly on Monday, with only the two-week rate down as the market awaited the results of the T-bill auction, traders said.
"This is just a sideways movement. It's in consolidation. We'll see what will happen in the T-bill auction which would foretell the trend in rates," a foreign bank trader said.
PHIBOR rates fell last week as the peso began to recover since it had a de facto devaluation on July 11.
Foreign banks were allowed by the Bankers Association of the Philippines to participate again on Monday at the Philippine Dealing System.
The normalisation of the peso, with the return of foreign banks, would pave the way for lower interest rates, traders said.
Average rates quoted by 20 banks were:
